imt: {\db}that\_one {\db}I.will.him.catch just
src: [oyo]\textsubscript{TOPIC} [enimugwata ara.]\textsubscript{COMMENT}
trs: That one, just give me a machete, that one, I’ll just catch him.

imt: {\db}9.road then {\db}\textsc{3sg-seq}-9.\textsc{om}-leave-\textsc{fv}
src: [Barabara]\textsubscript{TOPIC} ndipho [a-ka-\textbf{i}-rich-a.]\textsubscript{COMMENT}
trs: The road, then, he left it.

imt: {\db}10.money us {\db}\textsc{1pl-pres}-Ø-be.given-\textsc{fv}
src: [Pesa]\textsubscript{TOPIC} sino [hu-na-Ø-hew-a.]\textsubscript{COMMENT}
trs: Money, us we are given.

imt: {\db}1.that 1.girl {\db}7.that 7.box {\db}\textsc{3sg-seq}-7-lay-\textsc{fv} on bed
src: [Ulya munyere]\textsubscript{TOPIC1} [kirya kijumba]\textsubscript{TOPIC2} [a-na-ki-gwejez-a ku ngingo.]\textsubscript{COMMENT}
trs: That girl, that box, she laid it on the bed.

imt: rock that {\db}when he.saw he.is.not with {\db}of to.break Ø he.thought much
src: Ribhuyi eryo\textsubscript{i} [ejire arora [atari na [ja kwasisya Ø\textsubscript{i}]]] eeganirisya muno.
trs: \textup{That rock}\textsubscript{i}\textup{, [when he saw [he has nothing [to break (it}\textsubscript{i}\textup{)]]], he thought a}\textup{ lot.’}

imt: so {\db}that.one {\db}he.does.not.give.me things he.gives.me oil of lamp only {\db}that oil of lamp \textsc{excl} {\db}I.go.eat
src: Pho [yuno]\textsubscript{TOPIC} [kanipha vitu]\textsubscript{COMMENT} ananipha mafuha ga taa bahi, [go mafuha ga taa]\textsubscript{TOPIC} ndo [n’yarya?]\textsubscript{COMMENT}
trs: \textup{‘So t}\textup{hat one doesn’t give me anything, he only gives me lamp oil, that lamp oil -- can I g}\textup{o eat it?’}

imt: hyena he.spoke hyena he.lamented hyena he.got decision he.went-cut sap/birdlime he.put in.field his
src: Wamembe nayomba, wamembe nasurumbara, wamembe najira obhuramusi, bhwokuja-otema obhurembo, natura mumugundu gwaye.
trs: Hyena spoke, hyena lamented, hyena made up his mind, he went and cut birdlime (tree sap), (and) he put (it) in his field.” (Free translation by Steve Nicolle)

imt: lion he.heard(\textsc{seq}) that it.is.crying.for child lion he.told(\textsc{seq}) that old\_man
src: Wandare anayuvwa kwâkola mulirira umwana. Wandare anabwîra uyo mushaaja...
trs: \textup{Lion heard that it [the cow] is crying for (its) child. Lion told that old man...’}

imt: time when.it.arrived week that.they.agree they.were.called {\db}they.came {\db}those-two \textsc{name} and \textsc{name}
src: Wakati waifikire sumana yawasikizane, wakitíwa, [wakíja]\textsubscript{COMMENT} [wó-wawiri,]\textsubscript{TOPIC} Anli na Ntendaji.
trs: When the week that they agreed upon arrived, they were called, they came those two, Anli and Ntendaji.

imt: now {\db}she.sat {\db}woman that and {\db}things those {\db}she.cooked she.gave.to.them people
src: Sambi [akikála]\textsubscript{COMMENT} [muka ire]\textsubscript{TOPIC} na [vinu vire]\textsubscript{TOPIC} [akipíka akiwápa wanu.]\textsubscript{COMMENT}
trs: Now she sat down that woman and those things she cooked (them) and gave to the people.

imt: Leopard he.went to uncle to.greet misfortune {\db}meat {\db}he.left {\db}he.looks.at {\db}Dog
src: UDuuma aaheliye kwa mwipwave kuhungila kivembo. [Inyama]\textsubscript{TOPIC} [aalekile,]\textsubscript{COMMENT} [iloleela]\textsubscript{PRESUPPOSITION} [uMbwa.]\textsubscript{FOCUS}
trs: Leopard went to console his uncle for his bereavement. He left the meat, Dog was looking after it.

imt: {\db}they.put.him-there now {\db}lion
src: [Mbamuta-ko]\textsubscript{PRESUPPOSITION} woori [nyawatare.]\textsubscript{FOCUS}
trs: Now they put lion there.

imt: when he.went and.arrived he.told.her his.wife \textsc{quot} my.wife cook staple.food {\db}sauce I.will.know {\db}myself
src: Paukile ndawika kukaja kumwaulila ndyagwe do: “Ndyangu, taleka shakulya, [imbogwa namanya]\textsubscript{PRESUPPOSITION} [nimwene.]\textsubscript{FOCUS}”
trs: When he got home he told his wife, “Get some food ready for me, wife -- but as for the meat sauce, I’ll deal with that.”

imt: \textsc{excl} {\db}woman this \textsc{cop} {\db}she.did.to.me thing this
src: Kumbe [omukari wunu]\textsubscript{FOCUS} ng’we [yankorera eng’ana yinu.]\textsubscript{PRESUPPOSITION}
trs: Gosh, it was this woman who did this thing to me.

imt: {\db}work \textsc{rel} he.knew {\db}\textsc{foc}-trapping of fish
src: [Omoremo ghono yaamanyirë]\textsubscript{PRESUPPOSITION} [no-bhötëghi \!ubhwa sinswe.]\textsubscript{FOCUS}
trs: The work which he knew is fishing.

imt: land that {\db}they.were living-there {\db}women only {\db}\textsc{cop=3pl} {\db}they.were they.had.stolen cows of Mariro
src: Echaaro echo [:bhaariga bheekaye-mo]\textsubscript{PRESUPPOSITION} [abhagasi era,]\textsubscript{FOCUS} [ni=bho]\textsubscript{FOCUS} [:bhaariga bheebire jing’a ja Mariro.]\textsubscript{PRESUPPOSITION}
trs: In that land were living women only, it was they who had stolen Mariro’s cows.

imt: {\db}these guests {\db}\textsc{foc}=they.do these
src: [Yàbá bágénì]\textsubscript{FOCUS} [bó=bàgírá yìbì.]\textsubscript{PRESUPPOSITION}
trs: These guests, they (are the ones who) did these things.

imt: then people they.knew that {\db}she {\db}\textsc{cop=1.ref} who\textsc{.}did things those
src: Ndipho atu achimanya kukala [iye]\textsubscript{FOCUS} [ndi=ye ariyehenda mambo higo.]\textsubscript{PRESUPPOSITION}
trs: Then people knew that it was her who did those things.

imt: now while he.was he.still.be\_thinking so he.came frog
src: Woori bhunu :aariga acheeganiirisha mmbe \^{}n-aa-j-a waarukerwe.
trs: Now while he was still continuing to think, came a frog.

imt: it.emerged hyena it.has head of like person
src: ratuluka fisi, rina chitswa dza cha mutu...
trs: ...a hyena emerged, it had a head like a person’s...

imt: at start {\db}dog and leopard {\db}they.were with unity

trs: In the beginning Dog and Leopard were together.

trs: One day children went to herd.

imt: {\db}man one {\db}he.held day great at.home
src: [Mushoshi muguma]\textsubscript{S} [akagira]\textsubscript{V} lusiku likulu ha’mwage.

imt: now when he.was.herding day another {\db}buffalo {\db}it.came in-group of their.place that
src: Bhoono hano yaarëësyanga urusikö urwöndë, [eng’era]\textsubscript{S} [ekaasha]\textsubscript{V} mu-rihisho irya waabho riyo.
trs: Another day when he was herding, a buffalo came among their herd.
